title: Great pricing and website
text: Good pricing, no hidden fees when purchasing because everything is itemized. The website is easy to navigate as well. I didn‚Äôt have a problem figuring out how to point my recently purchase domain name to my web server. I had a couple questions but didn‚Äôt see a need to contact support because they have their documentation which helped because it was explained well enough for a layman like me. Overall, a good experience with purchasing my first domain name.

title: No sleazy upselling tactics
text: No sleazy upselling tactics. Slick UI that sensibly funnels me to what I need and lets me do what I want without getting in my way at every turn to offer me junk I don't need and certainly wasn't looking for. Good prices, too.

title: Best Price, Lots of TLD's to Choose!
text: Over a period of one year, We have moved all our domains (100+) from GoDaddy to Porkbun, They have very reasonable price and great panel to manage all your domains in one place. Keep up the good work, i have also referred a lot of our clients, friends to use them.

title: No bun intended
text: Porkbun is the real MVP! Not only did they save my bacon (no bun intended), but they made my experience with them a real hoot. From the easy-to-navigate website to their top-notch customer service, they had me squealing with delight like a little pig. And let's not forget their unbeatable prices - they really porked up the competition. Overall, I give Porkbun two thumbs up and a big oink out of five!

title: Simple, easy to use, and great "easter-eggs"
text: I love the whole experience provided by PorkBun. No frills, just get it done. Everything works great and smoothly every time. I especially love the little Dynamic DNS scripts that y'all built for use with your API. It's a fantastic little tool.

title: Almost Idiot-Proof
text: Easy.  Gets it done.   Follow the instructions--ask if you have trouble--do what you're told--pay up--done.   What more is there? Fairly comprehensible instructions...extremely good support.

title: I've used Porkbun for more than 5‚Ä¶
text: I've used Porkbun for more than 5 years, ever since GoDaddy "lost" my TVTOWER.COM business domain that I had since 1997. Porkbun is reliable and has provided excellent service. I currently have approximately 150 domains with them.

title: I have been an internet guy since 1996
text: I have been an internet guy since 1996, used many hosts, many ISPs, many registrars, all kinds of stuff. Porkbun keeps prices fair and has good support.  Keep on truckin'.

title: porkbun is great!!
text: porkbun is great. They have fair prices and a good support. The reason why I pick them is because of their prices. They are not cheap on the first like many other, but you can expect a more stable cost for your domain and on the second year they actually are cheaper than most alternatives out there.

title: Great service and better support
text: I am using Porkbun for over 3 years and I am very satisfied user. All their services are easy to use, and support is great in solving everything. I move all my business to Porkbun, with over 95% of domains purchased and renewed there.

title: I lost reserved many domains but porkbun‚Ä¶
text: I had reserved many domains but porkbun did not accept payment through my mastercard.  Even billing support was unable to resolve the issue and in the meantime, one of the domains in my shoppingcart,  FastForward.ai was taken by somebody else. Adding that card on porkbun was showing same error so I had to setup PayPal with the same MasterCard and pay for remaining.

title: No non-sense domain registration
text: No non-sense domain registration. Basic necessities, such as WHOIS privacy protection, are included (whenever is allowed by the TLD). I bought a premium domains, which is marked up quite unfairly by the TLD administration, Porkbun still offers a fairly competitive pricing. Although it may not always offer the lowest price, I am feel the deals are fair.

title: Porkbun is fair with refunds
text: Porkbun refunded my $24 email hosting payment, after it automatically shut down after domain expiry. They truly care about client experience and fairness. I'm currently a happy and loyal customer and will use only them for domain purchasing and management.

title: This was my first time buying a domain‚Ä¶
text: This was my first time buying a domain and I don‚Äôt know much about these kind of things but I felt save and informed all the way through the process with Porkbun. No hassle! Thanks!

title: Highly recommended for domainers
text: I have been using Porkbun.com to buy domains for a long time and have always gotten the cheapest price. Very simple and straightforward interface with an (optional) integrated marketplace where you can sell your domain. Highly recommended for domainers.

title: The main reason I started using porkbun‚Ä¶
text: The main reason I started using porkbun is the amazing web interface. Everything here just makes sense. Thank you for a high quality user experience.

title: Top-tier domain registry
text: I have already reserved 50 domains and can only say good things about Porkbun. The prices are great, and support responds quickly and competently.

title: Always brings a smile to my face
text: As someone from a completely different continent it took me some years to find Porkbun. But with time they have become my go-to when it comes to shopping domains, mainly because almost every topdomain is available. In combination with good prices and an easy-to-use management console that even I can manage (and that says something), its a no-brainer to use Porkbun. I usually recommend friends and customers who needs a domain to look at Porkbun first. They have also never heard of Porkbun but they always come back and said they created an account and bought the domain they were looking for. So can only recommend everyone else to go there as well!

title: No payment support for india
text: No payment support for india. Local payment gateway /methods must be added otherwise we have to migrate. I couldn't buy another domain due to payment Barriers. I don't have credit card. Please add razorpay or payU or upi option immediately. I want to buy new products urgently. I had to get credit card on rent. I don't own one. Will there be any Indian payment gateway available soon.

title: You can't make registering domain names easier than this.
text: You can't make registering domain names easier. The big discount helped a lot too. I registered this domain for a personal project, which I don't know how it would turn out. Getting the domain name at this discounted rate allows me to proceed with the project without worrying about the upfront costs. Branding is an extremely important part of any project. Porkbun made it possible.

title: Porkbun was there when another‚Ä¶
text: Porkbun was there when another registrar failed. Cost me an extra 17 cents but now I have the domain the other guys couldn't get registered

title: Porkbun - The Easiest Domain Registrar on the Planet
text: Porkbun is consistently the easiest Domain Registrar to work with, by far.  They are very forgiving on late renewals (sshhh, don't tell anyone).  Their pricing is 100% straightforward with zero gimmicks.  Plus, they do not spam you with upsells and offers.  If you have been abused at the hands of some of the major Domain Registrars, you know exactly what I am talking about.  Move your domains here now! The user interface is extremely easy to use. The only downside I see is, they do not allow teams to manage the account (e.g. one person handles technical, another billing / registration, etc.), so either the account gets shared (and you synch the 2FA with the appropriate authenticator), or it is a one-man show. Also, there is no reseller support, but with retail prices this low, it's hard to see how a reseller would fit in except as value add. I recommend Porkbun to all my clients.

title: Warm suggestion - try it!
text: Frontend of the site is super easy to understand compared to other registers. Once I have used online support, and assistant was very professional, giving clear instructions. All over this is my 3rd register, and I am quite confident that you will not regret by choosing to use it.

title: Would recommend to anyone!!
text: Been using them for years to help run my nonprofit. Responsive, polite; knowledgeable customer service and intuitive user interface. I‚Äôd recommend their services to anyone whether it‚Äôs just a personal website, wedding site, nonprofit, or retail, they do it all easy peasy. :)

title: Never had a problem with Porkbun
text: Never had a problem with Porkbun. Pricing is very fair, the management website is fairly comprehensive. I haven't had a reason to talk with the customer support, but I suspect they'll be helpful from the impression I've gathered.

title: I called Porkbun for assistance with an‚Ä¶
text: I called Porkbun for assistance with an issue using my purchased domain with WordPress.  My web guy has been unable to access my account.  I need someone to contact me immediately for a US telephone.  Thank yo for your assistance in this matter.

title: Very attentive service
text: Phone was answered promptly, and courteously. My problem was investigated quickly and efficiently, and explained clearly.

text: I found Porkbun a couple of years ago.  I could not be happier with their website and how it is laid out to keep track of your domain and renewals etc.   Very professional and seamless transactions.

title: The overall impression

title: Transparent, affordable and straightforward to manage
text: Porkbun is a breath of fresh air when compared to most other domain providers. Most providers aim to get as much money as possible from each consumer. Porkbun appears to be more customer-friendly, and while they do offer some upsells, they are far less obnoxious. Best of all, the domain pricing is unbeatable.

title: I am highly satisfied with Porkbun's‚Ä¶
text: I am highly satisfied with Porkbun's cost of domain registration, the availability of desirable domain names, the convenience and user-friendliness of the registration process, and the reliability and security of their services.

title: A reliable domain provider

title: The best bun of all!
text: I recently switch my hosting to Porkbun after having countless issues with Bluehost over the years. Overall, my experience so far with Porkbun has been flawless.  Philip assisted me through the entire process of moving over my company's website to Porkbun. He also helped optimize my site so that it would load faster. Our site now loads in under 2 seconds. (For context, when our site was hosted by Bluehost, it took about 10-15 seconds to load, and that was with all their optimization that they charged us extra for). I have also experienced zero down periods for my site with Porkbun. With Bluehost, my website would be offline for an average of 1 hour per day for reasons Bluehost was never able to explain. None of these issues exist for us with Porkbun.  Beyond offering great hosting and customer service, I must also point out how much I enjoy their newsletters. I know it's a silly thing to comment on, but each newsletter includes an original graphic and pun that genuinely makes me laugh. It's just a nice touch in addition to providing services I am very thankful for after experiencing years of headaches with Bluehost.

title: Simple interface and easy transfer
text: I imported several domains from a Very Serious Registrar after growing frustrated with bugs. I found Porkbun to be a delightful experience. So far, I'm happy I switched, and I'll probably be bringing in more domains eventually.

So far, vendor forces me to write review even before I had a chance to use their services. UPDATE: RE: "public information regarding email addresses and passwords that have been exposed via data breaches. This information comes from the public information regarding email addresses and passwords that have been exposed via data breaches. This information comes from the haveibeenpwned.com services. This has nothing to do with 1Password. services. This has nothing to do with 1Password." - Porkbun blatantly advertises `haveibeenpwned.com` which pushes me to use `1Password`. I am not in a position to lock all my passwords using single password, and I don't expect blatant Ads on a paid-for service provider (Pockburn). If you want to research security breaches - do it responsibly, you can use third-parties (haveibeenpwned.com) but you should take full responsibility (instead of referring us to third party). I wish your business growth and prosperity and I hope my feedback is somehow a little bit valuable ;)

title: I absolutely love Porkbun
text: I absolutely love Porkbun as a domain registrar! Not only are their prices extremely competitive, but their customer service is top-notch. Whenever I've had a question or issue, their support team has been quick to respond and helpful in resolving any issues. One of the things I particularly appreciate about Porkbun is their user-friendly interface. It's easy to search for and register a domain, and their checkout process is streamlined and simple. They also offer a wide range of TLDs (top-level domains) at affordable prices, so I can always find the perfect domain for my needs. In addition to their great prices and customer service, Porkbun also offers a number of useful features for domain management. Their DNS editor makes it easy to update DNS records, and their domain forwarding and email forwarding options are a breeze to set up. They also offer free privacy protection for eligible domains, which is a great added bonus. Overall, I couldn't be happier with my experience with Porkbun as a domain registrar. They truly are the best, and I highly recommend them to anyone in need of a reliable and affordable domain registration service.

title: Incredible status updates for domain transfer
text: I transferred a domain into Porkbun. The granular transfer status updates are incredible. For example, the transfer status page in my account would say "sending email", "sent email", "complete" [^1], etc. at each step of the transfer process. To me, this shows the amount of care and effort‚Äîon the engineering and the product sides‚Äîthat went towards providing such a pleasant user experience. Thank you; it is much, much appreciated! [^1]: Porkbun also linked to a KB article that provided more information about each of these granular statuses.

title: I've been a Porkbun customer for 3‚Ä¶
text: I've been a Porkbun customer for 3 years. In that time I've spent just under $17,000 on domain registrations for clients. Last week I had a request to submit ID - no problem and it was done using their automated system within 24 hours. Yesterday I had a mail to say they hadn't heard back and the account was at risk of suspension. Again, I've no problem with that and immediately mailed back to say it had in fact been completed. Today I've gone to register more domains for my clients and received a message to say the account was now suspended. No investigation or mails to me to say it hadn't actually been received - just a straight suspension of the profile.  To treat a client who has put through so much business this way is beyond belief. I'm hoping that this piece of feedback may speed up a response to the 2 mails that I'm yet to hear back on... Edit updated to 3 stars - I love the simplicity of the site and prices but this experience leaves a bitter taste. I resolved the issue myself by contacting livechat who undid the suspension but throughout the conversation offered no apology.

title: Very mixed experiance from me
text: Very mixed experience from me.  They are a good provider offering domains at a competitive price. However the way they handle abuse complaints is not good (At least it wasn't in the past but I am unsure of current business practises).  While I am not sure if it is still in practice, Porkbun would suspend your domain without contacting you first if they receive an automated Google safe search warning regarding the domain.  This happened to me in the past where google detected a false positive and Porkbun suspended the domain. It was clearly a false positive since I didn't modify the website whatsoever and submitted it back to google and it was approved as being clean with nothing wrong; this took maybe a few hours to 1 day for google to verify.  Porkbun left the domain suspended for days and wasn't very informative at the time because it was the weekend and abuse department was only monday to friday. This I found to just be a terrible business practise, i understand the need to remove abuse but the steps in place at the time of it happening to me need to be changed as it seems like there was no human intervention or double check and my domain was disabled just because of an automated google warning.  This isn't the first time this has happened either, you can lookup Porkbun domain suspended / suspension topics on forums such as LowEndTalk, Reddit, etc...

title: Absolutely fantastic.
text: It's often difficult writing great reviews for companies with such cheap services, as there's usually a shortfall somewhere. However, we've been using Porkbun for over a year now and it has been rock-solid. Not only that, we had a few snagging issues when we first signed up (as we signed up when they first started offering .uk domains - and we're in the UK), and they resolved the issues within minutes, not days/weeks. I always give it a little while before writing reviews, as I know that many companies offer a great service to begin with, then it deteriorates... but with Porkbun we have been consistently impressed. Their support team not only resolves issues, but also has a great chat with you and you know you're actually talking to a real human unlike with some companies where their staff are told to be robotic. The service, prices, and support is outstanding, and I'd give more stars if I could. Check them out, you can tell they're a company with a lot of ambition - they're constantly improving - and even better, their recent nameserver change had ZERO downtime for us, AND offers more features. Really happy with the overall experience and providing they keep up their amazing level of service, I'll continue using them for life.

title: Great products and excellent costumer service
text: I have several months of using Porkbun registering and transferring domains. My experience so far has been satisfactory. The reviews agree on the issue of good prices, with which I also agree. But going further, I really liked the customer service. They are very quick to respond, even in a matter of minutes even on a holiday or weekend, and get concrete and useful answers. The API once fully developed will take the service to a much higher level for the benefit of all customers.

title: I use porkbun for myself and clients because they don't overcharge or overcomplicate things. Great for developers and your everyday person.
text: I have 5 domains through porkbun and have used their hosting for both myself and clients, I have for multiple years. I've never had any issues. Support replies next day and helps me fix whatever I did wrong within US standard office hours in my experience (as they are actually a smaller business I'm happy to trade crappy 24/7 support with long hold times in favor of quality next day email support). Things are easy to setup, prices are not marked up (I find domains are the same price or cheaper than namecheap even).  SSL certificates are not an upcharge and done through Let's Encrypt automatically for you. "WhoIs Privacy" is not an upcharge either. In my opinion, this is how all registrars should do things.. Hosting is all reasonable, there's a basic and well priced managed wordpress plan and a basic site builder hosting plan for those less tech savy, as well as a basic static hosting plan, a full CPANEL, and even a basic PHP hosting plan for more tech savy folks. They're all pretty cheap and work great for small and medium sized businesses! It ticks me off when companies overcharge for wordpress hosting, it's predatory in my opinion, so porkbun not doing this is important to me even though I don't personally use it. Overall I see myself using porkbun for domains for as long as I buy domains. For hosting I'll admit I'm moving to hosting things myself on a digital ocean VM, but that's only because I'm lucky to have the skillset to. For those who don't I tell them to use porkbun's hosting plans.

title: A company you'll love
text: I have been a customer for 3 years, since 2020. Porkbun is nothing short of pleasant surprises. It's been a long time since I gave them a review, so I decided to write a new one to reflect my up-to-date experience. I decided to move from Gandi since the price was just not affordable in 2020 December. Then I found a peculiar name: Porkbun. People has been saying all the nice words about this company, and skimming through their company's homepage, I decided to jump ship. And it proved a correct choice. Price-wise, Porkbun does not always offer the best price for some domains. But they are open about it and offers a comparison to their major competitors. I recommend checking out Google Domains and Cloudflare Registrar if they are available in your country, since these two usually offer best prices along with Porkbun. Porkbun also offer web hosting. As with most experienced web masters, I do not recommend putting all the eggs in one bucket. There are other hosts that offer more competitive prices, more generous limits, or more features. But if you absolutely do not want to figure out these yourself, Porkbun's hosting services aren't bad. The only complaint I have is that the ads for the free WordPress and free static page offers are too big‚Äîbut since it's free, I won't complain too much. For stability, I experienced very little downtime since 2020. The most noticeable one was when they were DDoS'd, I don't blame them. The stability of the DNS servers and the website has always been great otherwise. Porkbun offers TOTP and U2F keys for 2FA. This is a huge plus for me, since this means a more secure account. And a more secure account makes a happier customer. I didn't have much need for customer support, but they reply fairly quick, often within 1 to 2 business days. See other reviews for more in-depth customer support experience. Overall, Porkbun has been a great registrar for 3 straight years, and I sincerely hope they keep at it, refrain from being customer hostile like a certain company with Go and D in their name. I just want more merch, like tote bags, webcam cover, or umbrellas maybe?

title: I love PorkBun for the most part
text: I love PorkBun for the most part. Decent prices, and good security. Love the free privacy, free DNS, free forwarding etc. Have not tried any of the free hosting. The only minor exceptions I have are that they lack some accessibility awareness and their domain management interface is a bit clunky for people that own many (as in hundreds) of domains. SPECIFICS: -- Accessibility: Poor contrast text on pages, and text that is too small or too thin. No dark mode. Some confusing navigation or unexpected actions. -- Browser back button: pages often lack a back button, or if they do have backward navigation, search results on the previous page(s) are lost, requiring a new search, cumbersome for incremental changes --- So for instance, if you go in to set a certificate or some other "next page" you lose you place, lose search results, lose where you were at, etc. - ORGANIZING -- No folders for organizing domains. The tag/label system is semi-useful, but incomplete. --- The domain search field is called "filter", requires a click to activate (preferentially it'd be an open field like the "REGISTER A NEW DOMAIN" field.  --- The search "filter" destroys any other filters set. --- It would be great if regex type searches could be done. --- It would be great if some searches could be saved as hot keys or custom menu items. - LABELS -- Not enough colors, no custom colors -- Can not sort by label --- Can not change order of labels in master list, which is a problem because the order shown on the domain is the order of the labels in the list. - API and CSV FILES -- No way to upload CSV files to set parameters or options of domains. -- Free API access is a great for setting DNS records. Hopefully they will add features such as mail forwarding, domainer/afternic, pricing, labels, etc. which would cover the reasons I need to upload CSV files. ------- It should be noted that a lot of what I mention is specific to the needs of someone with hundreds of domains, and otherwise are my wish list of features, and I don't want to take away from the otherwise good service and support here.

title: Mind the cheap prices and find something better.
text: They spare you several cents on renewal rates, but you eventually get what you pay for. Cheap means bad service. I had two abusive experiences with them and decided to move away to a more responsible registrar. First I experienced issues with their interface while updating my glue records as regardless of what I pasted there they would not update correctly. I deleted the glue to re-create them correctly as it seemed the only way to do this. Well it turns out that if you do that, Porkbun has configured their systems to reset your nameservers on ALL domains hosted with Porkbun that used the affected glue records to some random Porkbun nameservers, completely ignoring SOA TTL. This is technical sabotage and incompetence at the highest level. The second really bad experience occurred today when overnight, after receiving a supposed phishing report they nullrouted the main domain that was hosting the nameservers and took down over 200 websites. There was no abuse notice, no warning whatsoever, no email with the report that they received and no possibility to get the domain unsuspended unless I waited until it was morning and their abuse staff woke up to resolve this issue. Typical abuse notices go to hosting level first and if ignored they go to registrar and there was no notice at hosting level whatsoever. Also, the fact that they suspend you and go to sleep without giving you an option to confirm that you received the abuse report, you have fixed the issue and activate the domain back automatically is mind-blowing. Their staff is educated and courteous, but their policies are abusive to say the least. Moreover, their lack of transparency is even more concerning, hence the reason for which I am moving away from them. P.S. Do not trust most reviews you read here because they are from people owning one or two domains that are happy, not by people owning hundreds of domains. P.P.S. Just so Porkbun cannot say this review is fake: Malin / Palma Solutions

title: I am generally happy with the service but
text: I am generally happy with the service. They offer competitive prices for domain names and I am a loyal customer. However, recently I tried to migrate my WordPress website from another hosting company to Porkbun and my experience was terrible. They only support a third-party plugin to migrate and that third-party plugin requires you to purchase a premium plan if your file is big. That was my case. Why do I have to pay for the third-party plugin to migrate to Porkbun? It doesn't make sense...  Also, the support staff was rather irritated than supportive. I decided to stay with my current hosting company which is more customer centerd and has support available 24/7.  If you want just a simple domain name provider, it does the job but if you face problems the support is email only and worse than the others.

Porkbun's control panel for managing domains is also pretty easy to use. Simply click "details" under the domain to edit and I was able to quickly find and configure my DNS.  All the tools needed are all in one panel and not forcing you to click through multiple sections to find what you need.  Pricing is pretty reasonable and you can also save on the sales, so keep an eye out for them if you plan to get a domain!  Thanks Porkbun! This is how domain purchasing should be.

title: Porkbun: AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
text: Despite a sleek user interface and simple checkout, Porkbun is terrible at addressing abuse, and this isn't just my experience.  Simply searching Google will yield numerous instances in which Porkbun suspended domains (companies) based on competition reports.  My operating REGISTERED business has been suspended for three days now due to a non-existent report (they never show me the report) sent by competition.  Be advised, as stated in the agreement/domain name registration agreement:  "You agree that Porkbun may suspend, cancel, or transfer Your registration of a domain name in order (i) to correct mistakes made by Us, another registrar, or the registry in registering Your chosen domain name, or (ii) to resolve a dispute under Our dispute resolution policy." They can suspend or remove your domain ‚Äúfor any reason whatsoever. ‚Äú according to same page. One of our customers scans our site in scamadviser.com and according to this site: Porkbun (the registrar) is popular among fraudsters and criminals.

title: Porkun is a bait and switch operation
text: This company is heavily advertising, posting on "Sale" page incredible prices. But as soon as you go for purchase, the great price is gone. Example: as of May 2022 "The Mother's Day Sale!" promises multiyear promotion for tld .cloud at $1.51, but on checkout price applied to the first year only with additional years at $15.94. Not sure how company received high ratings on trustpilot, but suspect foul play. No reason to go to this company to have it as registrar for 1 year because renewals are expensive. ANSWER TO VENDOR REPLY: It still does not change the fact that you employ dirty advertisement tactics. Your company is listed on multiple "registrar ranking sites", known to take money  for the place in list. It can be easily googled, and you will see different heavily discounted rates with different types of registration of different tlds. But discounts do not exist, certainly you will say it's outdated information. But on so many sites? Regardless of your denial of involvement in advertising on ranking sites, this benefits only you. In real life, nothing happens free of charge, so please do not say that this is unrelated to your business practices or someone's human error.

title: Email Catch-All forwarding not provided, big hassle
text: I'm a veteran domain owner now for over 20 years. I know how to manage domains. After reading glowing reviews, Porkbun had me sold, I was just about to transfer all my domains to Porkbun, but when I happen to discover that catch-all email forwarding was not provided I stopped. Catch-all forwarding is a very important facility that most email users would find useful and many power users will eventually require. Porkbun's excuse is that is stresses their servers, so I was reluctant to believe that. I've had no problem with previous registrars, and I've managed to stop spam after it arises. It's a lot of hassle setting up email address and preventing spam without a catch-all forwarding facility. Porkbun's solution is to disable that altogether, for the benefit of their own servers, which makes me think they don't have very good infrastructure, or are on the cheap with low grade AWS hosting. Really, their reason for not offering catch-all's is lame and i transferred my domains elswhere. One thing I am upset about is that Porkbun never makes it clear on their promotionals or signup pages that catch-all is not provided, I had to find out from Reddit forums. Gotta love reddit.

title: Best. Registrar. Ever. (They're kind of a pig deal.)
text: I've been a full-time commercial web software engineer since 1996. I own 42 domains. 36 are with PorkBun (38 as soon as they're eligible for transfer. The other 4  have to remain where they are; since Porkbun doesn't support .si or .do CCTLDs, or they'd be there too). I have owned northwards of 100, and have sold single names replete with brand identity and logo for enough to pay for the full 100, too. I know of whence I speak. Let me be very clear: Porkbun is, without question, the best registrar online today, in terms of price, selection, amazing support staff, ease of DNS and *RECORD management... hell, even their search is in the top three (and I say that as one who's been contracted to WRITE one before. FOR a registrar. That's right: I used the 'bun even when I was EMPLOYED BY A COMPETITOR). I LOVE this registrar. Once you're over being done dirty by GoDaddy, getting screwed by NameCheap, dealing with the hassles surrounding Netim or OVH, getting a domain stolen from underneath you at CrazyDomains (ALL of which I've done/had happen) I sincerely hope you recall this review. You can thank me then. Update: Just noticed I'm up into the mid-50's (like that AND like that, alas) and wanted to reiterate: Still, without question, beyond a shadow of a doubt, HAM'S DOWN, one of my favorite companies to interact with, registrar or otherwise. Yanno when you talk to an employee of some org and they're just grinning like a loon the whole time? Just bloody delighted to be doing whatever task others call "work" (and they call "pork")?  Every time I deal with their support team I think to myself, "wow. What do they know that I don't? Maybe I'm in the wrong industry." Dunno. They just give off that vibe... the one Google used to, back when their motto was still, "don't be evil." For ongoing services or ad "hock" ones, I'm a lifer.

title: Backend password storing is broken! Unacceptable!
text: I wasn't able to create an account on the website. Tested on two devices. Website returned 403 Forbidden. Emailed support, they responded very quickly, told me it could be related to my VPN and that I should tell them my IP address so they can "investigate further". After I disclosed my IP address they ghosted me! I send them another email the next day but they didn't answer again. Very unprofessional! I managed to successfully create an account after three days from another computer at home. I think I got the reason why it wasn't working in the first place: It was because of the password which contained Extended ASCII characters! At least give the user a message that they should pick a password without them instead of just throwing "403 Forbidden" on a blank page! But it doesn't end here. After I purchased my domain for two years I logged out for a while and then tried to log back in. Password didn't work! My intuition tells me it's because it starts with a single quotation mark (it was generated randomly by the password manager). Not even regular ASCII is handled properly in the backend! I did manage to change my password and it went ok from there on, but it took me 3 days of tinkering just to register an account. You shouldn't need to pick a simpler (and thus more crackable) password just to please a dysfunctional form backend. Other bad things: The website is mess. The "Contact Us" link in the footer is just a blank javascript. That's just laughable (in a sad way). Good things: Although they ditched me after a short correspondence, the initial response was pretty quick. Sadly, this and the competitive pricing are pretty much the only good things about Porkbun. It does have a lot of potential but I'm going to rate it for what it is and not for what it could be. Honestly the review should've been one star but I'm trying as hard as I can to be objective.

title: I decided to register a domain on their‚Ä¶
text: I decided to register a domain on their website. At first everything was fine, I started making payments - a site error. Repeated many times, the error has not disappeared. I wrote to the support service. They replied "IP address you are connecting from has a fraudulent reputation associated with it". Despite the fact that I have a clean IP (without VPN) and have never had any problems with it. Restarting the Internet, the IP has not changed. After a long correspondence, it did not lead to anything. At first they didn't like my IP, then my address (all the data was correct, the city from the IP and the specified data matched). I've wasted my time, my nerves. I turned to another major registrar, registered the domain immediately, without any problems. The only reason people use this site is to save ~$5 because prices are lower than those of large registrars, but are you ready for the terrible quality of services? The score is minimal, I have not received any services. Website operation - 0/10 (payment does not work) Support service - 0/10 (indifference lasted a day and a half) Quality of services - 0/10 (services not received)

text: I tried out Porkbun in April 2019 and was very happy with the results, so over the past 2.5+ years I've transferred all my domains to them and recommended them to my clients as well. Eddie It looks like you setup a URL forwarder and have a previous wildcard record set, however the Wildcard option is setup for the current forward you have setup Eddie You'll want to resetup the forwarder and select the " Use wildcard URL forwarding" as well You So, it loads when you go to sos.gold but when you go to www. sos.gold it fails? You As I said, I‚Äôve done it before. But is still not working. Can you fix it for me, please? Eddie Unfortunately it's not created correctly, you need to create it again but making sure that. checkbox is checked so that it will work on any subdomains You Please kindly create it for me. Thanks. You If I do that, the images don‚Äôt load. Eddie The images don't load? You Yes if I do as you say, it doesn‚Äôt load images. That‚Äôs why please kindly assist and try to fix it. Thanks Eddie What images are you referring to? I'm not understanding. You Website images Eddie The URL forwarder shouldn't have any impact on your website's images, you'll just want to recreate the URL forwarder and make sure that box is checked so that any subdomains will forward on as well as the root domain You Please see my You my above replies, you‚Äôll see that I‚Äôve done that but the website images don‚Äôt load in that case. Kindly fix the issues for me. Thank you. Eddie Again, the forwarder doesn't have any control over what is loaded at the destination URL. title: Great email support + Yubikeys + Good DNSSEC support
text: Discovering porkbun is like realising you've been in a dysfunctional relationship for years with your current domain registrar, and it can stop now. I love their email support. It's so refreshing to communicate with people who actually understand. I love that they support Yubikeys for real account login security. I love that you can supply IPv6 DNS server glue and DNSSEC DS records via a web interface. If they added automatic polling for DNSSEC CDS/CDNSKEY record updates for clients with existing DS records, I'd be giving them 21 stars out of 5. Sadly, nobody does that yet, even though it would be so easy, but it wouldn't surprise me if porkbun started to.

title: New favorite registrar
text: Porkbun is my new favorite domain registrar. I've been gradually transferring all of my domains to them over the last year or so, and I think I'm finally completely bun-ified.  I came for their prices and free WHOIS privacy. But I've stayed for, well, that too, but also the fact that they've managed to breathe life, humor, and transparency into what is often a dull and spammy-feeling industry. They seem like a fun group of people who enjoy what they do. Customer support is always excellent, and the web app is easy to use and uncluttered. I've switched registrars a few times in the last ~15 years, but I can't imagine a reason I'd switch away from Porkbun.

title: This will sound like it was written by Porkbun. It was not.
text: Look, I cannot say enough nice things about this company. Every interaction I have had with them has been positive. They're straightforward with their language as well as their policies. Their prices are competitive (fantastic! but don't let them know). Often, the support documentation is enough to help me, and when it's not, there have always been helpful folks I can reach out to for additional assistance.  For perspective, as an IT professional with 25 years of experience - mostly in higher education and government contracting - I have dealt with a lot of 'vendors' throughout my career. I spent nearly ten years in roles where I was the primary vendor manager for the enterprise. I've spoken with literally thousands of companies and tens of thousands of people (not to mention dozens of poorly implemented, automated phone systems). Porkbun is easily among the top 5 companies I've ever worked with because it's just pleasant to do business with them.

title: I bought a premium domain for a lot of money... and had a big loss
text: I bought a premium domain for a lot of money. I received confirmation that the purchase was successful and that I am the owner of the domain. So I ordered a design and website from a development company for about three times the price of the domain. The domain was not displayed in the panel. After a few days I was wondering what was going on and wrote to support and they told me I didn't own the domain and they refunded the money. The refund took a few days. In the end my money disappeared for a week, I had a big loss because Porkbun made me believe I was the domain owner and also I had to pay a cancellation fee to the development company to avoid bigger losses. That way you will burn $ 1500 for nothing. Porkbun themselves only made excuses even when they wrote very clearly that I am the owner and that everything was successful, they reject any responsibility. You can buy domains there, buy a few ... or buy some domains on Porkbun that you don't rely on. If you're doing serious business or relying on a domain, you'd better buy elsewhere. --- Edit: Answer to Porkbun You did not warn at the checkout at the time i purchased the domain. The warning at the checkout you added to your site once you made the damage to me and i complain at you..  So please do not try again excuses that not fit. I even have screenshots of all the pages of the purchase process.

title: No whois control, slow and buggy dashboard
text: You have no control over your contact/who-is information. What is shown for your domain is REDACTED FOR PRIVACY everywhere and you can't change that. If you want to provide technical, abuse, etc. contacts--nope, sorry, can't let you do that. Talked to their support, they do not intend to change this at all. So if you want your clients to only be able to contact porkbun when reviewing your whois, this is the provider for you! I've utilised 4 other major registrars who do not limit your whois. Furthermore, the management interface/dashboard is buggy, difficult to use and at times quite slow. The registrar claims they offer renewal prices at a lower rate than any other company. While that's partially true, you will come to realise that paying an extra dollar or in most cases just a couple of cents and using a different registrar would save you a lot of time and get you a better quality service. I own a .io domain with this company and I will most certainly transfer it.

title: Pretty good, still room for improvement
text: I have around 30 domains for my own projects, hosted with three registrars, Porkbun have 5 and are the most recent of the three registrars I'm using regularly.  Pros: Good prices... not always the cheapest, but often are. Support are friendly if not always helpful. Simple control panel that's normally fairly easy to use.  Cons: Control panel is missing a few features I would like to see, I can still do what I want but I have to go about it in a different way. Support: both times I've had problems, my eventual solution has been to use a different company. Make of that what you will.  If you're thinking of using them for your .uk domain, be careful, they've only just started offering them and there are some teething problems. In short even with the domain privacy turned "off" (data is redacted in their own Whois, but they're supposed to send the registry your real data), Nominet were not receiving my registrant data, even when I tried to update it on their control panel it just errored. My eventual solution to avoid Nominet's data validation failure/domain revocation was to transfer the domain to another registrar then correct the registrant info. Not ideal. A shame as their renewal price is very competitive and I have half a dozen of the lil .uk guys.  Overall, I think they're pretty good, I think they're trying. They're worth your time if you have other options you can work with too. But as yet I'm not totally prepared to rely on them for all of my domain needs.

title: I recently found out about Porkbun‚Ä¶
text: I recently found out about Porkbun through Reddit. Previously I didn't even know they existed. After viewing their site and reviews I decided to to move one of my domains over to Porkbun. So far, I am loving the experience, management UI, transparency, and pricing. I even activated their hosted email on that domain and my email is working beautifully even though I am using Cloudflare DNS. 10/10 would recommend Porkbun and I will be moving all of my domains over.

title: Be aware their multiple credit card charge and threat
text: They charge you multiple times for domain renew. We requested refund and they threaten to delete the domain.   Be aware of those guys. You know, for a few tens of bucks to threaten customer, how can this be a reliable service. Just use AWS route 53. Update: the fact is that they charged twice for the amount of $105. Each $105 is for two year renew. We simple requested to say if they can refund one of them. They told us that they can delete our domain completely within 72hrs or we have to leave with a 4-yr renew. It is not the money. It is really their tone of treating the customer sounds like a threat. We could post their reply here.  Their reply here are not truthful. It is not a yearly renew. It was a double charge of 2yr renewal. They can simple tell us that they cannot refund and we could accept that. But they should not threaten the customer and post fake info.

title: DNS servers down leaving all client websites offline!
text: Yesterday all of Porkbuns DNS servers went down, making all their clients websites unreachable for several hours. That's a long reaction time, but the bigger problem is that there are no updates on the situation.  Normally when a company is quiet during problems, it means that they are going out of business. Which means your URL's can get locked up behind bankruptcy laws! I hastily replaced all DNS servers and was contemplating in panic mode to move the URL's to get out while I could. Finding the replies here on this review site from Porkbun, it looks like there was a DDOS attack. However, DNS servers were not back up worldwide at the time I read those replies. I still don't know if the DDOS attack is over and if their DNS servers are operational again. Their DNS servers are not pingable and they simply don't communicate to their customers. Not on their website, blog, or social media channels. They only replied here on Trustpilot for potential new customers. Existing customers apparently don't matter. EDIT: Thank you for the quick reply. Let's hope communication will be better next time. I had a two providers that went bankrupt in the past and they let you know with absolute silence. Followed by a world of trouble. Therefore communication is crucial. Especially during the outage. I replaced my DNS servers because I didn't know you were working on it and nearly moved the URLs as well.

title: Finally a human-centric registrar and web host
text: Where to start? I don't think I could possibly deliver a review as glowing as it needs to be to match the unparalleled experience I've had working with Porkbun. The support is friendly, conversational but professional, and almost always instantaneous. Looking over a couple of recent support requests, I'm seeing response times measured in seconds or minutes, not hours and days. Beyond the absolute humanity of the support experience, I'm also thrilled with the lack of red tape, fine print, and nonsense‚Äîeverything about the offerings make sense, there are no gotchas, and the support team never makes any excuses. These people (PEOPLE!) are hungry to be helpful, and you can feel it. And that has made all the difference.

title: What makes a great domain host anyway?
text: What makes a great domain host? "Service" is such an ambiguous word. Why do you need "service" to register a domain you found? Well, I found that a domain I registered violated a copyright and I was able to get a refund right away, via online chat. But aside from service, you need transparency. Registering a domain for $1 sounds great until the next year when they want $99 or they want to hit you with a fee to transfer it. Porkbun doesn't do that. You see all the prices for the first year AND renewals AND transfers AND any extra fees. I've been very pleased with them and I plan to use ONLY Porkbun in the future. I just wish they had an affiliate program.

In India Rupay Card has a larger market than Visa/Master Cards. Almost every banks in India issuing Rupay Cards only and it becomes a big headache to place the order in International sites like porkbun. If the payment option is simplified for Indian customers also, my rate would be 5/5 with no doubts.

I proceeded to login after remembering my password and I only wanted to renew one of my domains and remove the other. title: We got there in the end
text: UPDATE 14.08.2020 It turns out my support email landed in Porkbun's spam inbox resulting in them only seeing it three days later after seeing my trustpilot review. The domain was placed on hold by the registry (not Porkbun) for allegedly spamming although this is entirely false and has now been removed from the spam blocklist and re-enabled. Porkbun were never notified of the suspension, which is unusual and it was a manual entry. I would like to thank Phillip from support who apologised for missing my email and then acting as the go-between me and the registry. Previous review 10.08.202: Nice, simple user interface with excellent use of branding however their support leaves a lot to be desired. I initially chose Porkbun because of how positively they were rated and good prices. I bought a .me domain on the 31st of July only to have it go offline sometime overnight on the 7th. I sent an email to support over 24 hours ago and have not received a response back or an answer to my Twitter DM. No acknowledgement, no "we're looking into it". Contrast this with my hosting at another company, and they answered me within 20 minutes to say the issue was likely on the registrar's end. Maybe I should have stuck with them for domains too. This is simply unacceptable. I'm very lucky this wasn't for anything major. If it had been a business? Well, I'd have been screwed. I really wish I had something more positive to say. UPDATE: Have now been waiting for over 72 hours. Their website states email turnaround is under 24 hours. This is absolutely unacceptable. Would not trust Porkbun for anything critical that you want 24/7 support for.

title: I've been using PorkBun for several years now, and with marginal issues!
text: As someone who has been around since InterNIC, it takes quite a bit for me to move. In 2017, I moved everything to PorkBun, despite having over a decade left on some renewals.  Why? First of all, Ross. Second of all, Owen. Third?  Great prices to go with the great support.  They integrated IPV6 within days of me teasing Owen, and Ross was always my go-to guy for anything. Several years later, and I'm still a big fan of PornBun.  Their services are second-to-none as far as registrars, their self-hosted DNS works pretty darn well, and the few times I throw them a curveball, I can expect an answer in 24 hours. I haven't been happier to have a go-to registrar in the last 20 years. Thanks, Porkbun.

title: 5/5 experience!
text: I recently moved my domains from Namecheap to Porkbun and I am very happy with that transfer! They offer great prices. Cloudflare registrar offers wholesale prices (AKA registry price with no markup), sure, but Porkbun offers tremendous value for the extra dollar. They offer email forwarding, 3 months of email hosting, and ability to change nameservers. These are not available at Cloudflare registrar. In short, Porkbun is probably the cheapest registrar with best value. I love it.

title: By far the greatest domain purchasing‚Ä¶
text: By far the greatest domain purchasing experience I've ever had. It's effortless. No hidden fees or complicated terms of service. No hoops to jump through if you want to stop renewing a domain, you don't even have to navigate away from your homepage to find your renewal options. It takes literally one click. They put the button right there. If you turn off the auto-renew on a domain, you don't get bombarded with follow-up emails for months on end. The price for the first year of a domain, particularly non .com domains, are unbeatable. Some just dollars. This combined with the ease of toggling renewal options makes Porkbun the absolute best platform to bulk purchase domains in order to protect options in the case that you haven't decided what to name a business or site.

title: Porkbun - the only Domain Registrar to Use
text: Porkbun has excellent domain name prices, free WHOIS privacy, and free SSL certificates. You won't find that at most of the big name registrars. You can try their hosting for free and if you decide to keep it, it's only $24.00 per year. Try finding that elsewhere. They also offer almost any domain name extension you might want. And they don't jack the price up high for renewals like most domain name registrars. Above all, they don't play games like ionos who adds things you didn't request. They are, hands down, the best company to buy a domain name from. I have used them for many years for many domain names without ever having a problem. They even offer great phone support if you have a question. And they are also just plain fun.  I absolutely recommend Porkbun!

title: Garbage Support
text: In my many years of using divers registrars and hosting companies, this one is right at the very bottom of the pile. Their support is utter garbage when you run into any form of difficulties; they will tell you, yes we will get back to you as soon as possible; well that may be shortly before the second coming, and when you finally send in a reminder, they will give you a half-baked response that will never solve your problem. They claim to be one of the cheapest registrars out there, that maybe the case but the savings is not worth it when the pain comes back to bite you when you least expect. The fact that they build their motto around A PIG, should at least tell you something. I usually never one to gripe about poor service providers and I have never written a poor review about any host or registrar but this one has compelled me beyond any reasonable doubt that mediocrity has finally found a home in the pacific northwest of the U.S

title: Poor support and standards.
text: Poor support. Now my website, which is on a $400 premium domain has been suspended apparently for having a 'fake shop' on it. This is utter rubbish as I am building a new site on it, have taken no orders and cannot take orders. I contacted them to tell them this was a mistake and their support told me they were so sorry and it was a mistake, and they are so sorry etc etc... then I check back 8 days later and the domain has been suspended again... its a poor service and poor standards all round at porkbun. I assume from reading all these good reviews from people with 1 review to their name they are paying for good reviews as well.

text: Porkbun has a fun brand but, more importantly, their customer service is amazing (when I get hung up on trying to make new changes and realize I don't know what I'm doing). I don't know how they do it. I am so happy I found them - moved all my domains to them.

title: Porkbun is terrible
text: Porkbun is terrible. I purchased the $12 monthly cPanel monthly plan because I have a custom site using PHP mail. Their description reads: "If you're looking for a more generic shared hosting plan then cPanel might be for you. While not specifically designed for a particular type of website, it's a good option if you want to install a prebuilt or custom PHP site." The form wasn't working correctly so I had to pay a developer to try to troubleshoot the problem, only to find out it is a server issue. They have disabled PHP mail. During a live chat session (which was more like ask a question and receive an answer 15 hours later - super helpful when you are paying someone for their time to look into your website bugs!!) the rep said: "PHP is available on cPanel, but PHP mail is a specific feature we have disabled for security reasons." Wow! Can you imagine my confusion based on the description of the monthly plan I had JUST purchased saying "it's a good option if you want to install a prebuilt or custom PHP site." Nowhere does it say that PHP mail is disabled for security reasons though?  Okay, so the rep suggests using an SMTP plugin to send the mail that way. I asked if he had any suggestions and he did not. Okay, that's fine as well. I shoot a message to the developer WHO I AM PAYING FOR HIS TIME IN ALL OF THIS about what the rep had said using an SMTP plugin. The developer gets back to me after installing the SMTP plugin and says it should be all set. I do the test and sure enough, I am still not receiving the message sent from the contact form! I speak with my developer and he says there is absolutely nothing he can do at this point. He has done thousands of website forms with this exact script. It has been determined once again A SERVER ISSUE. I am so upset at this point as I have wasted DAYS troubleshooting this issue with very little to basically NO HELP whatsoever from pork bun. I have also wasted lots of money paying a developer for something that pork bun falsely advertises. God only knows what their excuse for this issue will be. Either way, I have had a terrible experience with Porkbun and would highly discourage anyone from signing up for any kind of account with this company. Terrible business

text: A registrar with simple UI and great prices.  I used PorkBun a few years back for one particular TLD that had a good price, but I'm slowly moving all my domain portfolio over to PorkBun. From a technical point of view, it has all features too: from DNSSEC to Glue records to faster NS update times. I like that it has free email and URL redirects, and AFAIK, PorkBun is the only registrar with SSL URL redirects.

title: GoDaddy Transfer -- Oops
text: I transferred my domain from GoDaddy to Porkbun last week and am extremely impressed so far.  First, the price is half for the exact same service. Winner.  Second, when something went wrong and I forgot to reconfigure my name servers and email servers (I foolishly thought they transferred), I was contacted by a friend to let me know he emailed me and it bounced. In a bit of a panic (given I realized my business account must have been down for at least 4-5 days), I got on a chat with Phillip H. at Porkbun and he helped me get everything set back up in less than 20 minutes, all through a chat window. Super nice, easygoing, and understanding. Customer Service A+ on that and my original transfer when I had another question as the process was happening.

title: Best choice for your money
text: I've had this Domain Provider for a while now and I can't be anymore satisfied with the service they provide. Customer service is very helpful when you need them. If they are offline, they will get back to you the next morning (in my case) if you used the 'Email Option'. Any and all domains purchased with them are also equipped with Free WHOIS Privacy and SSL cert. which is amazing. But this is where it falls short unfortunately and why it's not exactly 5 stars. Their hosting and email options are good but I wish it would come at a bundle price. Unless I'm missing it, you have to pay for the services individually. I can see that some might want one or the other, but for me, I'd like to have it bundled for simplicity. Please correct me if I'm wrong and there's in fact an option for this. In conclusion, this provider in my opinion is top notch and a fantastic choice when looking for a domain. If you are looking for options to host an email with that domain or make a website, you can but you would need to purchase them on a separate 'plan'.

title: Porkbun is THE best registrar out‚Ä¶
text: Porkbun is THE best registrar out there. Bar none. I have tried them all; bought and sold domains with them all, and transferred them into and out of them all for various reasons.   ALL the others have one gotcha or another.  Without exception.  Some with too many gotchas and weird policies to even count.  Like forgetting to tell you they remove domains from your control panel if you decide to delay renewal for a period but still within the grace renewal period. Like making you click on three different boxes or dropdown menus to complete a purchase after they have taken the money from your card or paypal. Like tripling their price after year 1. There are SO many ways every other registrar tries to trip you up. Literally EVERY other Registrar I have used. Porkbun - have NO 'gotchas' that I have found. What is there support like? I have NO IDEA - why - because I have never needed their support as far as I remember! Everything is fast, intuitive, WORKS, and, their policies are really fair and laid out clearly.  Their prices are fabulous, and consistent. Everything they do, is, fabulous, and consistent. I guess I should come off the fence.  They are pretty damn good! (I know - that name. Porkbun. But you never forgot it once you heard it, did you?!)

title: The one Registrar for my domains, the one to rule them all.
text: I register Domains since 2003, for my business, clients and friends. This is the very first time I have found a trusty Domain Registrar with a very simple and intuitive dashboard from where I can manage every aspect of my domains on my own. I can manage Registrant Contacts, the domains status, the lock/unlock, the auth-code, the whois data, redirects, dns records and DNSSEC with their 4 nameservers or change the authoritative NS and also register my own vanity nameservers GLUE records. I can even insert my 6/8 custom nameservers without being limited in numbers. A pretty thing is that I can organise my domains portfolio with "labels". Every service at Porkbun is very fast as much as their support service response time! Easy, simple and fast at a fair price. Yes Ms. Porkbun, I'll keep to use you from now on! So, oink me too!

text: Porkbun is honestly my favorite domain registrar to date. They have really great prices, they're a small company with a very personal touch, and it's just plain simple. I have had some issues with their dashboard in the past, and upon emailing their support and having the ticket sent to their technical team, oftenI have received an email back from the CTO himself with a fix already in place. It's also nice that they are just up the highway from me, in Portland, so I'm supporting a business based where I am. They are aimed toward a slightly more technical audiance, but with the addition of phone support a while ago and the quick connect feature it's still very useable for very nontechnical people. Their support is friendly and helpful, and for me having easy email support is nice, so I don't have to wait on the phone or wait until morning to ask a question. Overall 5/5, will always recommend.

title: Excellent! Top of the line.
text: I already have about 100 domains with them, and I will transfer the majority of my other domains to my Porkbun account, because of the: 1. Affordable prices 2. User friendly website 3. Great support 4. Lack of hidden costs Best player in the business 2019! The only thing I could wish for is a hosting account where you are allowed to use more than one domain (per account)...

Overall a really fun experience and not badly priced at all. Love it.

title: Exceptional experience - but...
text: Exceptional experience and the best price possible!! If I was going to take a half star off it would be because you need to override their default nameservers when registering a domain name. It would be great to be able to set my own default nameservers in my account for each domain name - thanks for the reply but now I‚Äôll have to dock you in the rating down from 5 as that reply is simply garbage. Changing the name servers AFTER registration creates delays. I‚Äôm speaking from first hand experience with multiple domains registered with you. Every single other registrar I‚Äôve dealt with in more than 15 years has allowed this setting to be pre-set upon registration for a deployment, especially in an emergency such as a client having their email server go down and they need a stop-gap domain set up to get. Usiness rnsils running again; making it possible to get up and running sometimes immediately but always within an hour (or 4 with smaller registrars) for a new registration. Even godaddy, which I despise dealing with, allow this. My closing recommendation to you is that, in future, when someone makes a suggestion... don‚Äôt just tow the company line and essentially say ‚Äúdeal with it‚Äù even in a polite way only helps you seem PC)

title: Fair pricing, great support, solid backend
text: Unlike the big names in domain registration, Porkbun charges only a small markup over wholesale, which is the only reasonable way to do it considering the small overhead of handling domain registration. If your domains are registered at Godaddy or Namecheap, you're getting scammed. They offer nothing of value that you can't get from fair registrars such as Namecheap but charge twice as much (or more). Don't let low first year prices fool you, you'll likely have the domain for a lot longer than a year and there is no indication that Godaddy and others will stop raising prices.

title: They took my money, they did nothing, I lost my business.
text: Updated: It took this review to get their attention. I DID receive an apology and they did cover the costs of recovering the expired domain name. I hope they use this example as a learning experience going forward. I did have a loss of use of the domain one week but at least I received an apology for the oversight of the transfer. ---------- I transferred my very first domain name two pork bun 2 months ago. They charged me a fee which was paid and sent me an email and it was marked success. 2 months later I get a notification from GoDaddy stating that my domain name has been canceled and returned back to the general population because the transfer never went through. I contacted pork buns technical support and let them know this very situation and they said there's not much they can do when you initialize a transfer on a domain that has been pending cancellation. that's not what was accomplished here, they did not take responsibility for the transfer that had been initialized two months before godaddy's cancellation. I emailed them a second time letting them know that I lost my domain name after I got off the phone with GoDaddy. I am completely devastated. they never emailed me they never followed up with me they never notified me of any problems with the transfer. Nothing. Their response was: Hello, I have issued a refund for the transfer, you should see that hit your account within the next few days. Please let us know if we can assist with anything else. Never an apology never any explanation is to what happened no remorse. I will never use this company again. Thanks for my money back porch fun. I just lost my domain name that was the heart and soul of my business. Thank you for sending me an email saying the word "success" when you didn't do anything with whoever except for that my domain name expire.

title: A real person answered the phone!
text: I may have to edit this, since I'm a first-time buyer.  More than the great prices, more than the wide selection of TLD's, more than the FAQ/knowledgebase, was the fact that when I called to verify some information before buying, the phone was answered by a REAL HUMAN BEING!  No phone tree, no disgusting hold music.  She answered all my questions (patiently, I might add), even double checking a couple of them to make sure she gave me accurate information.  The whole thing may not work out, who knows?  But in this age of phone trees and surly bureaucrats, to reach a real person immediately, and get answers from somebody who's not afraid to say "I don't know, let me check" is definitely worth 5 stars!

title: Hosting so slow, my web dev won't touch it!
text: I'm actually shocked to see the 5 star reviews. I was thrilled to try out an affordable alternative to some of the 'big names' but it's left a bad taste in my mouth. Prior to signing up for hosting - I chatted in to get information because their own site was so slow it kept kicking me out and 504'ing. I was assured it was because of how quickly they're growing, and it doesn't impact their hosting at all. Super. Load. Of. Crap. My site's not even done yet, has less than 4 products on it, css is minified, everything is compressed and it is still taking 5 seconds before the FIRST ping! I work on sites daily (SEO) and I have never experienced such a slow site. (Hello, 1997?) I sent it to my web dev and he won't even touch it until I switch hosting providers, because he says there's nothing he can do until I get new hosting (it's not worth it to try, apparently, it's that bad.) When I emailed in today, I was told that the 'hosting isn't for everyone' and is a 'one size fits all.' Uhh. That would have been nice to mention before I bought my 4 domains through PorkBun, especially when I specifically asked. Cannot recommend. And I'm locked into their hosting for 2 months apparently. So I guess I can launch my new site (with the products i've worked tirelessly on for 8 months) in 2 more months... after I switch hosting. Ludacris. 1 star because it forces you to leave at least 1. +1 additional star for a cute mascot.

title: Great value with no bait and switch
text: Many domain registrars actually overprice but not Porkbun. Also, they don't lure you with a ultra-cheap first year and then ask for an arm and a leg for the next renewal. Their prices are good value at sign-up and renewal is similarly priced, so you know that what you are paying for is what you can expect to pay the following year. They have a very pleasing and easy-to-use user interface. I haven't had to contact customer support yet, but so far everything just works with their nameservers.

title: US based registrar you can trust
text: US based registrar you can trust. Simple and inexpensive. We're transferring over 50 of our domain registrations to porkbun.com. Previously we were distributed across multiple registrars, most with add-on fees. Porkbun.com includes DNS hosting and WHOIS privacy in their registration fees. I evaluated 14 different registrars and porkbun.com had the lowest renewal pricing of them all. And they're ICANN accredited!

title: Closed my affiliate account without any notice

Everything did seem so straight forward and easy, and I liked them in the beginning. This changed my view...

title: 20+ Years w/ ~1K Domains Prefers Porkbun
text: Hi, folks; Daniel here ~;-)  Having been at this since the last century, and portfolios adding up to around a thousand domains, I have experienced nearly every registrar's best and worst.  Over half of my domains are at Porkbun.  Serves as prima facie evidence that they are most often the best option...  Their prices are typically among the lowest for new registrations, renewals and transfers (and I do carefully compare, and track down the specials that save money).  Speaking of money... theirs is the most generous policy in regard to expiry that I have ever seen, which allowed me to keep domains I otherwise woulda simply let go.  They offer free Let's Encrypt SSL certificates, and allow full DNS control.  Their Web site is improving constantly, with a good interface for domain management. (Consider the difficulties of having so many domains under one customer's account.)  Their support is excellent; although not available 24/7, they're quick to respond to every issue I have encountered: They are proactive, even aggressive, about security.  They don't support all 1,000+ extensions, and there's those rare domains (< 1%) that can get too tricky to register there (e.g. requiring trademark agreements to be signed, or that weren't meant to be ~;-)  Perfect? Nobody is. But, even being nit-picky? I'd give 'em a 96% overall score... when a domain is valuable, or otherwise important, Porkbun is an excellent choice.

text: I've owned domains since the 90s so I've seen my fair share of good, bad, and ugly when it comes to domain registrars. The very choice to call it "Porkbun", a name no corporate drone would ever approve, seems indicative of their free spirit. I'm not really a techie, so take this review with a grain of salt, but should I ever need more domains, Porkbun is where I'm going to come.

title: Superb company
text: I love Porkbun. I've only been using them a couple months but their offerings and pricing is really superb. I became very frustrated with other registrars that make their online interfaces as difficult as possible to navigate and are always trying to market/upsell you something else. Fair prices, clean design, and easy to use. The creme de la creme of a domain registrar. Thank you, Porkbun!

title: found exidently 2 years ago and since I‚Ä¶
text: found exidently 2 years ago and since I moved step by step all domains so far the cheapest domain host I found with an high end backend and very fast replay. top notch service team

title: Excellent domain registrar!
text: I have been using Porkbun for a year now and it is excellent! Very pleased with the functionality, services included and the quick support.

title: Simple & Clean
text: I managed to get my .design domain name first year free with a Porkbun special deal and I've been in love with them ever since. Just registered my second domain name with them. Good prices, good deals, website is extremely easy to use and isn't full of...  advertising and stock images of smiling office people and all that annoying stuff. Simple and clean. When I first registered with them I was disappointed there was no Paypal support but I just saw they have it now, so I'm very happy!

title: Great offers
text: Great offers, I tell ya

title: I've purchased several domains from‚Ä¶
text: I've purchased several domains from them and it's always been a great experience. I prefer their domain management interface to most others and plan to move my domains here that are currently with other registrars.

title: nice service
text: Date of experience:   August 11, 2018

title: I recommended trying porkbun's‚Ä¶
text: I recommended trying porkbun's services, their prices are competitive, they offers free whois (may not matter now with GDPR) and their backend is easy to use when it comes to setting DNS etc. I wish more companies were like them.

title: I Love EVERYTHING about porkbun
text: I Love EVERYTHING about porkbun!  I've moved all my domains, and have recommended it to everyone I know.  Fantastic support too. The best of the best :-)

title: Awesome people!
text: Awesome people! Fun, fast and human experience. Just what I desire. None of the tricks of the domain industry like hiding information or avoiding actions. They are transparent. They deserve their high growth! PD: did you see their prices?   WOW what prices! I mean OING OING!

title: Great domain registrar
text: Great domain registrar. Fast. Easy. Full featured. Did I mention great prices? I am real impressed with the free domain privacy. They also have a smattering of tlds.

title: The Process Went Smoothly...
text: The process went smoothly, quickly and I am Very Satisfied!

title: Simple and easy to use
text: Simple and easy to use. Also, do love the personal touch to all the messages in general. A very welcome tone as compared to the cold tone that most companies adopt. loved the overall experience

title: Very fast and simple website
text: Very fast and simple website.  I love porkbuns om nom nom.

title: Awesome domain service
text: Awesome domain service. Been using them for about 2 years now, and no problems whatsoever! Using mostly the new TLD names :-)

title: Legit registrar
text: Legit registrar. Super cheap prices, and above average domain management UI. No point in using any other registrar as far as I'm concerned. Hope they keep the low prices.

title: Easy
text: Easy, trustable and cheapest domain registrar out there. I highly recommend them.

title: Excellent service, panel and great services.
text: Excellent service, panel and great services. What more can I ask for?

title: Great
text: Great. Affordable. Credible

title: Great services
text: Great services, very competitive prices for general consumers, and renewal rates are the same as registration rates.
